data.title: Putting the Massive Losses in America’s 10 Largest Companies in Context
data.text: The bloodbath that created the major panic selling on Monday, March 9, 2020 was caused by a double-whammy of the continued spreading of the coronavirus outbreak coinciding with a fresh all-out oil price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia.

data.title: Facebook’s board is its most gender-balanced yet with two new additions
data.text: On Monday, Facebook announced the addition of two new names to its board of directors, Nancy Killefer and Tracey T. Travis. Killefer brings potentially valuable government insight to Facebook, as she served in the U.S.

data.title: Facebook names two women to its board, nearing gender parity
data.text: Facebook announced Monday that Nancy Killefer and Tracey Travis are joining the company's board of directors, boosting its female presence to 40%.

data.title: Tech's big five lost over $320 billion of value in Monday's market crash; Apple plunged 7.9%
data.text: Tech stocks led the S&P 500 to a record last month, and are now plunging along with everything else.

data.title: Facebook adds two female board members
data.text: Facebook Inc.  said late Monday that Nancy Killefer and Tracey Travis were joining the company's board, effectively immediately.

data.title: Facebook sued by Australian privacy watchdog over Cambridge Analytica scandal
data.text: The social network allegedly violated the privacy of more than 311,100 Australian users.

data.title: Why Facebook Stock Fell Monday
data.text: The social network's stock fell along with the broader market.

data.title: Buy the Dip in These 7 Online Advertising Stocks Now
data.text: Online advertising stocks have sold off sharply in recent weeks on coronavirus fears. Here are 7 to put on your watch list.

data.title: Australia sues Facebook over Cambridge Analytica, fine could scale to $529BN
data.text: Australia’s privacy watchdog is suing Facebook over the Cambridge Analytica data breach — which, back in 2018, became a global scandal that wiped billions off the tech giant’s share price yet only led to Facebook picking up a $5BN FTC fine. Should Australia prevail in its suit against the tech giant the monetary penalty could […]

data.title: Australia Sues Facebook For Data Breach Of 300K Citizens In Cambridge Analytica Case
data.text: The office of Australian Information Commissioner Angelene Falk has sued Facebook Inc.

data.title: Australia sues Facebook, alleges breach of user data
data.text: The Australian privacy regulator filed a lawsuit against Facebook Inc accusing the social media giant of sharing the personal details of more than 300,000 people with political consultant Cambridge Analytica without their knowledge.

data.title: Facebook sued by Australian information watchdog over Cambridge Analytica-linked data breach
data.text: Facebook alleged to have committed serious breaches with data collected by This is Your Digital Life app used by Cambridge Analytica for political profiling
